section.name: name
section.description: hc - an HCLI for interacting with a CNC via GRBL (e.g. an OpenBuilds BlackBox controller via input and output streams

section.name: description
section.description: The "hc" HCLI allows you to control a CNC through the command line (e.g. OpenBuilds C-Beam Machine) via the GRBL protocol. You can send G-Code commands as an input stream, and the GRBL service will respond accordingly.\n\nThis HCLI relies on the use of a serial port to a GRBL compliant device. You can scan to find out which serial device you can send G-Code streams to.

command.name: scan
command.description: The "scan" command scans and lists connected serial devices.

command.name: device
command.description: The "device" command sets the serial device to use to stream G-Code commands.

command.name: stop
command.description: The "stop" command stops the CNC by sending the ! command to the GRBL controller.

command.name: connect
command.description: The "connect" command connects to the GRBL controller.

section.name: name
section.description: scan - scan for avaiable serial ports to stream G-Code to.

section.name: description
section.description: The "scan" lists available serial devices that could be used to stream G-Code commands to.

section.name: name
section.description: device - sets the serial device to stream G-Code to.

section.name: description
section.description: The "device" command lets you set the serial device to stream G-Code to (e.g. hc serial /dev/tty.usbserial-AR0JI0GV).

section.name: name
section.description: stop - sends the stop signal (!) to the GRBL controller.

section.name: description
section.description: The "stop" command sends the stop signal (!) to the GRBL controller to force stop all CNC movement. This immediately suspends into a DOOR state and disables the spindle and coolant. If in motion, the machine will decelerate to a stop and then be suspended. If executed during homing, GRBL will instead halt motion and throw a homing alarm.

section.name: name
section.description: connect - connects to the GRBL controller.

section.name: description
section.description: The "connect" command connects to the GRBL controller.
